#summary Charlieplexing and LOL shield.

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charlieplexing Charlieplexing] is a technique
of driving a LED matrix by a minimal set of signals with tri-state capability.

[http://dev.squarecows.com/wp-content/plugins/wp-o-matic/cache/53161_lol_shield_schematic.jpg]

[https://www.olimex.com/Products/Duino/Shields/SHIELD-LOL/ Olimex LOL shield]
is an example of affordable Arduino shield, which uses charliplexing.
With only twelve pins D2-D13 you can control a matrix of 9x14 LEDs. It is essential for control signals to have a real tri-state capability. Any extelnal pull-up or pull-down resistors will cause blur on the screen.

[https://www.olimex.com/Products/Duino/Shields/SHIELD-LOL/SHIELD-LOL-SMT/images/thumbs/310x230/SHIELD-LOL-SMT-2.jpg]

For example, to light a top left LED, you need to:
 * Set pin D13 high
 * Set pin D5 low
 * Set all other pins to tri-state
